LanguageData.PawnGroupGuideContent:
[Group Types]
• Combat: Battle groups for raids • Trader: Trade groups, must include traders • Settlement: Settlement garrisons • Peaceful: Peaceful visitors
[Weights]
Commonality determines selection probability.
[Points]
Limits maximum combat power. Usually set very high for storyteller control.
[Role Configuration]
• Options: General combatants • Traders: Merchant core (Trader groups only) • Carriers: Pack animals/porters • Guards: Escorts protecting merchants
Warnings: • Deleting all Combat groups prevents raids • Trader groups without Traders fail to generate
LanguageData.ConfirmCreateSettlement:
Faction established. Create settlement now?
(Settlements required for faction to appear in-game)

LanguageData.WikiMascotTip: Sly raccoon - Click to view on Steam Workshop
LanguageData.Wiki_Principles_Content:
[Core Principles]
This mod intercepts the PawnGenerator.GeneratePawn method using Harmony Postfix patches, intervening immediately after the game generates a pawn to apply custom gear configurations.
[Technical Implementation]
• Interception Timing: Harmony Postfix triggers immediately after the vanilla GeneratePawn method completes • Override Logic: The mod clears vanilla-generated gear and applies custom configurations • Scope: Only affects newly generated pawns (new raids, caravans, reinforcements, settlement defenders) • Data Persistence: All configurations are saved in the game component, separate per save file
[Gear Tag System]
Each pawn kind has gear tags that determine which items can be used. Gear tags control what equipment a pawn kind can access from the item library.
• Simple Mode: Adjust weights for different categories (weapons/armor/clothing) to influence randomization • Advanced Mode: Directly specify items, bypassing random pools • Weight Mechanics: RimWorld weights are "selection weights" not "guaranteed picks" - higher weight means higher probability but not 100%
[Budget Limits]
Each pawn kind has preset apparel and weapon budgets. The system decides whether to generate equipment based on these budgets.
• Default Behavior: Equipment exceeding budget is skipped • ForceIgnore Option: Ignores budget limits, forcing all configured gear (may create "god-tier" characters) • Recommendation: Keep budget limits for normal gameplay, enable ForceIgnore for creative mode or high difficulty
[Body Part Conflicts]
RimWorld's apparel system is based on body part coverage - only one item can occupy a body part.
• Detection: Uses ApparelUtility.HasPartsToWear to check if body parts are occupied • Typical Conflict: Two bulletproof vests cannot be worn simultaneously • Solution: Enable ForceIgnore to attempt forced override of conflicting gear
[Advanced Mode Details]
Advanced mode provides fine-grained control:
1. Specific Items Abandon random pools and directly specify equipment. The system strictly follows configuration, unaffected by randomness.
2. Material Override Force equipment to use specific materials: steel, plasteel, devilstrand, etc. Leave empty for game defaults.
3. Quality Override Set equipment quality range from awful to legendary. Quality directly affects stats and value.
4. Style Override Supports Ideology DLC style overrides, allowing specific religious/ideological apparel styles.
5. Selection Mode • AlwaysTake: Equipment always appears on the character • RandomChance: Randomly decides based on set probability • FromPool: Randomly selects one from specified item pools
6. Forced Hediffs Add health states to generated units: bionic limbs, implants, drugs, diseases, etc.
7. Item Pool System Group items into 4 different pools, each with independent weights. The system randomly draws from pools based on weights.
LanguageData.Wiki_Terminology_Content:
[Core Concepts]
PawnKind Definition: A pawn kind definition describing a character type (e.g., pirate gunner, tribal warrior). Explanation: Think of it as a "class" or "template" - each PawnKind determines base stats, equipment preferences, skill levels, etc.
Faction Definition: A faction composed of multiple pawn kinds. Explanation: Various forces in the game like pirates, tribals, empire, player colony. Each has diplomatic relations, tech level, and pawn composition.
[Gear Related Terms]
Gear Tag Definition: Tags marking which items can be used by which pawn kinds. Explanation: Like product category tags - "military", "tribal", "noble", etc. Pawn kinds use tags to determine available equipment.
ApparelMoney (Apparel Budget) Definition: Maximum silver value a pawn kind can spend on apparel when generating. Explanation: The character's "shopping budget" - equipment exceeding budget won't be purchased/generated.
WeaponMoney (Weapon Budget) Definition: Maximum silver value a pawn kind can spend on weapons when generating. Explanation: Same as above, but specifically for weapons.
[Selection Mode Terms]
Selection Mode Definition: Rules determining how equipment is selected.
• AlwaysTake Definition: Equipment always appears on the character. Explanation: 100% generation, no randomness.
• RandomChance Definition: Randomly decides based on set probability. Explanation: Like rolling dice - 50% probability is like flipping a coin.
• FromPool Definition: Randomly selects one from specified item pools (Pool 1-4). Explanation: Drawing from a preset "lottery pool".
[Advanced Settings Terms]
Force Ignore Definition: Forcefully ignore budget limits and body part conflicts. Explanation: Ignore all rules, forcefully equip all configured gear. May create "god-tier" characters but could cause issues.
Force Naked Definition: Strip all apparel when generating. Explanation: Generate the character naked, then only equip what you specify.
Force Only Selected Definition: All vanilla/existing gear is stripped before applying custom gear. Explanation: Strip first, then equip your specified gear - prevents vanilla/custom mixing.
Biocode Definition: Biocoded weapons bound to specific characters. Explanation: Weapons have a "DNA lock" - only specific characters can use them, others get mood penalties.
[Item Property Terms]
Material Definition: The material used to craft equipment. Common Materials: Cloth, leather, steel, plasteel, uranium, devilstrand, gold, etc. Effect: Material determines protection value, durability, weight, and appearance.
Quality Definition: Equipment quality level. Range: Awful → Poor → Normal → Good → Excellent → Masterwork → Legendary Effect: Quality directly affects equipment stats and market value. Legendary can be 2-3x better than awful.
Stuff Definition: Material items that can be used to craft equipment. Explanation: Cloth for clothing, metal plates for armor, etc.
[Health State Terms]
Hediff Definition: Any health-related state on a character. Categories: • Implants: Bionic limbs, organ replacements • Drugs: Addictions, tolerances • Diseases: Infections, plagues, cancer • Injuries: Cuts, burns, bruises • Other: Pregnancy, age-related degeneration
Severity Definition: Hediff intensity level. Effect: Disease severity determines symptom severity, drug severity determines effect strength.
[Pawn Group Terms]
PawnGroupKind Definition: Determines the purpose of this group in the game.
• Combat: For raids, sieges, and combat scenarios • Trader: For caravan generation, must include traders • Settlement: For faction settlement defenders • Peaceful: For peaceful visitors, travelers
Commonality Definition: Relative probability of this group being selected. Explanation: Higher weight means this group appears more frequently.
Points Definition: Limits the maximum combat power of this group. Explanation: Controls group strength - higher points allow stronger characters.
[Other Terms]
DefName Definition: Unique identifier used internally by the game. Explanation: Like an ID number - each Def has a unique string like "Pirate", "TribalWarrior".
TechLevel Definition: Technology level of items or factions. Levels: Primitive → Medieval → Industrial → Spacer → Ultra Effect: Determines which equipment can be used - high-tech gear won't appear in low-tech factions.
Xenotype Definition: Genetically modified human subspecies introduced by Biotech DLC. Examples: Sanguophages, pigmen, mole people. Each xenotype has unique genetic traits.
LanguageData.Wiki_Workflow_Content:
[Quick Start]
This chapter guides you from zero to using this mod, covering the complete workflow from creating presets to exporting and sharing.
[Step 1: Create Preset]
Presets are the basic container for saving configurations. All gear configurations must be saved in a preset.
Steps: 1. Open Mod Settings (Main Menu → Options → Mod Settings → Faction Gear Customizer) 2. Click "Preset Manager" button 3. Click "Create New Preset" 4. Enter preset name (e.g., "My Custom Config") 5. Optional: Add description for future reference
Tip: It's recommended to create a "Backup Preset" on first use to save vanilla settings for recovery.
[Step 2: Select Faction]
The left list shows all available factions.
• Faction Categories: Human factions, animal factions, mechanoid factions, others • Color Coding: Gray means the faction doesn't exist in current game • Search: Use search box to quickly locate factions
Action: Click faction name to expand and view all pawn kinds under that faction.
[Step 3: Select Pawn Kind]
The pawn kind list shows all PawnKinds under the selected faction.
• Icon: Shows the pawn kind's default appearance • Name: Display name of the pawn kind • DefName: Internal identifier
Action: Click pawn kind name to enter the editing interface.
[Step 4: Configure Gear - Simple Mode]
Simple mode is suitable for quick adjustments through the weight system.
Interface: • Weapons: Ranged weapons, melee weapons • Armor: Helmets, bulletproof vests, etc. • Clothing: Shirts, pants, jackets, etc. • Others: Accessories, belts, etc.
Steps: 1. Click "Add" button to open item picker 2. Check items you want this pawn kind to use 3. Adjust slider to set weight (0-100) 4. Higher weight means higher selection probability
Budget Settings: • Drag budget slider to adjust total budget • Low budget may prevent some gear from generating • Set reasonably based on faction tech level
[Step 5: Configure Gear - Advanced Mode]
Advanced mode provides fine control for specific needs.
Switch: Click "Simple/Advanced" button at top
Advanced Mode Features:
1. Specify Items • Click "Add Weapon" or "Add Apparel" • Search and select specific items in the picker • Can add multiple items to form a list
2. Set Item Properties Click edit icon next to item: • Material: Force specific material (empty for random) • Quality: Set quality range (e.g., Good-Excellent) • Selection Mode: AlwaysTake/RandomChance/FromPool
3. Configure Item Pools • Pool 1-4: Four independent item pools • Each pool can contain multiple items • Set pool weights to affect draw probability
4. Add Hediffs • Click "Add Forced Hediff" • Select Hediff to add (e.g., bionic leg, drugs) • Set Severity • Set Chance
5. Advanced Options • ForceNaked: Generate naked • ForceOnlySelected: Only use specified gear • ForceIgnore: Ignore budget and conflict limits
[Step 6: Live Preview]
Preview lets you see modification effects before saving.
Steps: 1. Click "Preview" button to open preview window 2. Window shows generated character appearance and gear list 3. Click "Rebuild" to refresh preview 4. Adjust seed value to see different random results
Note: Preview is only available in-game, limited functionality in main menu.
[Step 7: Batch Operations]
Batch apply quickly applies current config to multiple pawn kinds.
Steps: 1. Click "Batch Apply" button 2. Select target pawn kinds in popup window 3. Can "Select All" or check individually 4. Click confirm to apply
Use Cases: • Unify uniform style across entire faction • Quickly configure similar pawn kinds
[Step 8: Save Changes]
All modifications must be saved to take effect.
Steps: 1. Click "Save Changes to Current Game" button 2. Changes take effect immediately, no restart needed 3. Newly generated characters will use new config
Important: • Modifications only affect newly generated characters • Existing characters are not affected • Preview before saving to confirm effects
[Step 9: Preset Management]
Presets can be exported for sharing or imported for use.
Export Preset: 1. Select preset to share in Preset Manager 2. Click "Export" button 3. Preset data copied to clipboard 4. Send string to friends or post to community
Import Preset: 1. Click "Import from Clipboard" 2. Paste preset string 3. Confirm import
Notes: • Imported presets may depend on specific mods • Missing mods will show some items as missing • Check compatibility after import
[Step 10: Faction Group Editing (Advanced)]
Faction groups determine how factions generate various unit combinations in-game.
Access: 1. Select faction then click "Pawn Groups" tab 2. View all group configurations for that faction
Group Types: • Combat: Combat groups for raids • Trader: Caravan groups, must include traders • Settlement: Settlement defenders • Peaceful: Peaceful visitors
Edit Points: • Commonality: Higher weight means more frequent appearance • Points: Controls group strength • Options: General combatants • Traders/Carriers/Guards: Specific roles
Warnings: • Deleting all Combat groups prevents raid generation • Trader groups without traders fail to generate caravans
[Complete Workflow Example]
Scenario: Make all empire soldiers wear red power armor
1. Create preset "Empire Red Legion" 2. Select "Empire" faction 3. Select "Empire Soldier" pawn kind 4. Switch to Advanced Mode 6. Set selection mode to AlwaysTake 7. Click Batch Apply, select all empire combat pawn kinds 8. Preview to confirm effect 9. Save changes 10. Export preset to share with friends
LanguageData.Wiki_Notes_Content:
[Important Notes]
This chapter covers essential information for using this mod, including effect mechanisms, compatibility, common issues and solutions.
[Modification Effect Mechanism]
When Effects Apply: • Modifications take effect immediately after saving, no restart needed • Only affects newly generated characters (new raids, caravans, settlement defenders, etc.) • Existing characters on the map are not affected • Units already generated in ongoing events won't change
When Effects Don't Apply: • Existing characters and animals • Player colony starting characters (unless regenerated) • Some special event units (depends on event implementation)
How to Verify: • Use preview function to see generation results • Wait for new raids/caravans and observe gear • Use dev mode to force spawn for testing
[Preset Management Notes]
Preset Purpose: • Presets are configuration containers, all modifications saved in active preset • Switching presets loads different configuration sets • Presets don't affect each other
Important Reminders: • Deleting presets won't rollback changes already saved to game • Applied configurations continue working even if preset is deleted • To restore vanilla, must manually reset or load "vanilla" preset • Regularly export presets for backup
Save Independence: • Each save file independently stores configurations • Configurations don't auto-sync when switching saves • Prompt to select preset when first entering a save
[Common Issues and Solutions]
Issue 1: Gear not generating as expected Possible Causes: • Budget limits: Equipment value exceeds pawn kind budget • Body part conflicts: Body parts occupied by other gear • Tech limits: Equipment tech level higher than faction • Race restrictions: Some races can't wear specific gear
Solutions: • Enable ForceIgnore option • Check and adjust budget settings • Confirm equipment matches pawn kind tech level • Check race apparel compatibility
Issue 2: Some items can't be selected Possible Causes: • Item disabled by other mods • Item requires specific DLC (Ideology, Biotech) • Item tech level too high • Item is quest/event exclusive
Solutions: • Check mod load order • Confirm required DLCs are installed • Use search to confirm item exists
Issue 3: Game lag or crashes Possible Causes: • Large number of items causing complex generation calculations • Conflicts with other gear modification mods • Circular references or invalid configurations
Solutions: • Reduce number of items per pawn kind • Check mod compatibility • Reset configuration and troubleshoot step by step
[Advanced Options Warnings]
ForceIgnore: • Completely ignores budget limits • Attempts to force override body part conflicts • May create "god-tier" characters, breaking game balance • Recommended only for creative mode or testing
ForceNaked: • Strips all vanilla apparel • If subsequent config is incomplete, character may actually be naked • Ensure sufficient alternative gear is configured
ForceOnlySelected: • Removes all vanilla gear • If custom list is empty, character will have no gear • Recommended to enable for full control
[Compatibility]
Fully Compatible: • Combat Extended (CE): Ammo system works normally • Humanoid Alien Races: Alien race gear works normally • Vanilla Expanded series: All VE items available • Ideology DLC: Style system fully supported • Biotech DLC: Genes and xenotype system supported
Known Limitations: • Some mods that completely overhaul gear systems may conflict • Dynamic gear generation mods may produce unexpected results • Mods that modify PawnKindDef may overwrite each other
Recommended Mod Load Order: 1. Harmony 2. Core 3. Other large mods (e.g., CE) 4. Faction Gear Customizer 5. Small patch mods
[Performance Optimization]
Avoid Performance Issues: • Keep pawn kind gear lists reasonable (suggest <50 items) • Avoid complex rules for large numbers of pawn kinds simultaneously • Use item pools instead of specifying each item individually • Regularly clean up unused presets
Large Mod Pack Users: • First load may take longer to build cache • Item picker may have brief delay when opening • Previewing large numbers of pawn kinds may lag
[Backup and Recovery]
Recommended Backup Strategy: 1. Export "vanilla config" preset before first use 2. Export current preset before major modifications 3. Regularly backup entire save files 4. Test compatibility before sharing presets
Recovery Methods: • Load backup preset • Reset specific faction/pawn kind • Complete reset of all configurations
[Multiplayer and Sharing]
Sharing Presets: • Exported preset strings contain all configurations • Recipients need same mod environment • Recommend sharing mod list together
Multiplayer: • Host configuration determines generation rules • Clients don't need this mod (host only) • Ensure all players use same configuration version
[Developer and Debugging]
Dev Mode Features: • Force spawn specific pawn kinds for testing • View detailed generation logs • Modify configurations in real-time and observe effects
Debugging Tips: • Use preview function for quick verification • Gradually increase complexity to troubleshoot • Check game logs for error information
[Best Practices]
Beginner Recommendations: 1. Start with simple mode, familiarize with weight system 2. Modify single pawn kind first, observe effects 3. Create backup preset before large-scale modifications 4. Preview frequently to verify configuration
Advanced Tips: 1. Use item pools to create random but themed configurations 2. Combine Hediffs to create unique pawn kinds (e.g., all bionic) 3. Use batch apply to quickly unify faction style 4. Create different presets for different game stages
Creative Playstyles: • "Iron Legion" - All power armor • "Special Forces" - All carrying specific weapons • "Future Warriors" - All bionic enhanced
[Technical Support]
Troubleshooting Steps: 1. Confirm mod is latest version 2. Check if required mods are missing 3. Try resetting configuration to see if issue disappears 4. Check game logs for error information 5. Submit issue report on Steam Workshop or GitHub
[Help Channels]
Click links below for help or to report issues:
• Steam Workshop Page https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3670833973
• GitHub Repository https://github.com/yancy22737-sudo/FactionGearCustomizer
• QQ Group (Player and Tech Discussion) Group: 984338429
